intro: Monnina floribunda, commonly known as redroot flax, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soils, making it a hardy addition to native gardens. Monnina floribunda is also valued for its ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
